column3: General ACK, what happened with RPCConsole? Can you post a screen?\n

Nothing major, it just shows the network name instead of a checkbox.

Why not test it yourself?
I observerd that a screenshot helps getting ACKs without the need to test an uncontroversial pull.\n

But the point of pull requests is also that people help test them

I always test pulls before merging, but for my own pulls it helps if someone else does it too.
I got the point, often I don't take the time to really test every single Qt-pull, but mainly the "big ones". I'm trying to re-think this and yes, I understand you.\n

![weird](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1419649/1789211/d6fed8f8-6950-11e3-9ba0-c9e78a12204e.png)

IMHO that new layout looks weird, see the buttons?
Strange...\nGoing to re-do that change manually in the XML instead of using the UI editor. Looks like it changed around a lot of ancillary stuff.\n
Ok cleaner change now, thanks for checking.\n

Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/89fc1067718867daeddabcf0a86596b30b74a184 for binaries and test log.\nThis test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/cu
If you re-work the 2 nits I can ACK this, GUI is fine now.\n
Should this comment be changed everywhere, where we use `SelectParamsFromCommandLine()`? I'm talking about bitcoind.cpp and bitcoin-cli.cpp, I suggest using the same comment there.\n
Can you remove this new-line, please?\n
Nah, no need for that. I'll change the comment back.\n
